definition: to glue/to paste/to adhere/to stick to
(classical particle similar to 於|于[yu2]) in/at/from/because/than/(classical final particle similar to 嗎|吗[ma5], 吧[ba5], 呢[ne5], expressing question, doubt or astonishment)
(classical particle similar to 於|于[yu2]) in/at/from/because/than/(classical final particle similar to 嗎|吗[ma5], 吧[ba5], 呢[ne5], expressing question, doubt or astonishment)

sentences.english: In one Spanish town , everything is turning up red and squishy!
sentences.chinese: 在西班牙的一座小鎮，一切都變得紅彤彤，粘乎乎。

sentences.english: No matter where feel, it is to stick lampblack, call a person afflictive .
sentences.chinese: 無論摸哪裏，都是粘乎乎的油煙，叫人難受。

sentences.english: It's a blob and can be of any shape.
sentences.chinese: 它們往往是粘乎乎黑糊糊的一團，可以是各種形狀。

sentences.english: The thin sick chicken picks the thick sticky stick quickly.
sentences.chinese: 瘦病雞快速地啄粘乎乎的粗棍。

sentences.english: In summer people feel sticky in that relative humidity is quite high.
sentences.chinese: 夏季人們感到皮膚粘乎乎的是因爲相對溼度很高。

sentences.english: The sticky toffee made my teeth uncomfortable.
sentences.chinese: 粘乎乎的太妃糖弄得我的牙齒很不舒服。

sentences.english: But being psychologically clingy iseven worse.
sentences.chinese: 而心理上的粘乎乎則更糟糕。

sentences.english: But being  psychologically clingy is even worse.
sentences.chinese: 而心理上的粘乎乎則更糟糕。

definition: variant of 黑糊糊[hei1 hu1 hu1]
muddy/covered in (mud, dust, sweat, blood etc)/daubed in
